cards.rules_text:
The future is a new zone. The future is a place for certain cards to start in, in order for them to be playable from the future or have special effects from there. The future is a public zone. Cards in the future can be tapped and/or face down, and can have counters.
Your future can start with up to three cards in it. When deckbuilding, you choose what cards will start in your future. Only cards that say they can start in your future can start in your future. You may sideboard cards in and out of your future, provided that your future still follows its constraints.

Unmolded [i](As this enters, choose a creature type. Put a counter of that type onto this.)[/i]
As this creature deals damage, do one of the following — [i](This happens before checking for lethal damage on creatures.)[/i]
• Put a counter on it of a kind already there.
• Move a counter from it to another creature you control.

Refraction [i](This card may start in your future. You may cast copies of it from your future.)[/i]
Add one mana of any color.
You can't cast spells named Chromatica until end of turn.

Refraction [i](This card may start in your future. You may cast copies of it from your future.)[/i]
Choose a subtype. Put a counter of that subtype on target permanent you control. [i](It doesn't gain that subtype unless it has that subtype's type.)[/i]
Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

Refraction [i](This card may start in your future. You may cast copies of it from your future.)[/i]
Target artifact, enchantment, or creature becomes a 4/4 artifact enchantment creature in addition to its other types.

Refraction [i](This card may start in your future. You may cast copies of it from your future.)[/i]
Add {R}{R}{R}{R}.

Exalted [i](Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)[/i]
If a triggered ability of a Remnant you control would trigger, you may have that ability trigger an additional time.

Exalted [i](Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)[/i]
Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, draw a card. You gain 3 life.

Trample
If Vel, Poison Prodigy would deal combat damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter instead. [i](A player with ten poison counters loses the game.)[/i]
You may cast Vel, Poison Prodigy from your graveyard by discarding a card in addition to paying her other costs.
Whenever a Cat you control dies, draw a card.

cards.type: Kindred Enchantment — Iron Bat Cat Rat Spider
cards.rules_text:
Temporal [i](This card may start in your future.)[/i]
As long as Iron Ideals is in your future or on the battlefield, change the text of other permanents and spells you control by replacing all instances of “Bat”, “Cat”, “Rat”, and “Spider” with “Iron”.
Whenever a Cat you control dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.
Whenever a Rat you control dies, each opponent discards a card.
When Ironfang Trickster dies, destroy up to one target creature. If you controlled it, create three 1/1 red Iron Rat creature tokens.
{1}, Sacrifice this token: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. Activate only as a sorcery.
Exalted [i](Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)[/i]
